_O62i6psIqWpEgt0T205aw.text: I don't know why I keep on returning there, it's not that good.I've had maybe 6 meals there, all very average, and kinda expensive for the quality (£8 - £13 a dish) but I guess the setting is nice, square communal table, cool decoration. Actually, I know why i go back: its next to my office. Practical but not yummy place.

bpDomtdKR3K0EW14c7JVDA.text: Busaba eYuck - in case you were wondering how I reeeeally feel. I can understand liking the scene. And the swish layout. And the incense. And the design forward elements. But none of those frilly factors trump good food for a fair price and attentive service - none of which were present in our recent dining experience. After receiving our two pint-sized main dishes, we decided to call it a night and asked for the bill. 10 minutes later we asked again. 10 minutes later we asked again. 10 minutes later we stood up... just stood up, put our coats on and waited for our server to bring us the bill. 45 minutes after finishing our meals and asking for the bill we walked out, flanked on both sides by a line snaking out the door. Go for it. Enjoy. Sorry for taking up those seats for so long.

2Swv9iB6s5u6NeyKn9lwsA.text: NOT GREAT! Especially if you have to eat gluten free. They very bluntly refuse to swap out egg noddles for rice noodle.  Arrogant and small minded in this day and age. Wagamamma do and there food is much better.

PU5di3qrHVRKgpMoFDjJFQ.text: Thai food is one of my favorites, so I was excited to try a restaurant near where I live to, maybe, find my new favorite spot and since this place is always packed I thought the chances are good! BUT I have to say I really did not like the food they served. My friend got the duck curry and I got the pad thai, because I heard the pad thai is the best thing on their menu.If the pad thai really is the best thing i don't know how this restaurant is so packed! I thought the pad thai was awful, granted I lived in San Francisco and have high standards, but even at a bad restaurant in San Francisco the pad thai is better than here! and the curry looked more like a broth than actual curry! I would not recommend this place! They also don't have any deserts on their menu!

2F-Q91p9F-4DKfSiwq88uA.text: I really thought I was going to love Busaba Eathai - I wanted to love it. 2 mins from home I was hoping for a regular lunch spot. As the reviews all state - great decor, friendly staff, nice ambience and yes the food is tasty. The portions just felt a bit mean - especially the drinks. There I have said it. Maybe I am just greedy but I was left feeling that it wasn't quite enough. And for the money we paid it should have been. Perhaps I didn't order well and should give it another go...maybe. There is a lot of competition for lunch in Shoreditch - better than yelo round the corner but not much. Yes it looks great, has a buzzy atmosphere and the food is good - just not somewhere to go if you are really hungry unless you want to run up a king size bill.....

Qya6oZ8rAK0eh0kVd4C5vg.text: According to what my friend said, this Busaba Eathai is better than all others in London. Food taste good and its less oily. There isnt alot of people around lunch time so really quiet. Good for one person as well because they have really nice window seats.

z4ZO66fyGN64LYTYN_ts1Q.text: For me, ethnic food shouldn't be about a scene, but a food. I am officially lifting my "I only write if I like" mantra for the duration of my living in London. There simply aren't enough yelp reviews here to merit only writing about things that I like. I need to just add to the general pool. In San Fran, even the smallest joints have at least a couple hundred reviews...Anyhow, the atmosphere was nice and I like communal eating, but the food was decidedly mediocre. We had:Jungle Curry (not at all what I think of with thai curry... the sauce was thin, like a broth) and was not that spicy, though marked spicy on the menu.Pad Thai (best dish we had here, but still not even near the best I've had)Chicken Satay was fine, nothing special.Chicken and Squash stir fry. Tasty, I liked this one.Considering how trendy this place it, I am surprised people put up with such soso Thai food. Wagamama is much better as far as communal eating chain Asian places go.

6g4pwnuTO_jo4KRBooAylw.text: It's a good Busaba restaurant. The food is as good as any other Busaba Eathai (Musaman Duck is still one of the best curries I've ever had !), and unlike other critics, I really thought the Pad Thai was of comparable quality as what you find in other good thai restaurants.However, when the menu mentions "Spicy", you can be sure it's really hot, so be careful !In addition, there is more space in-between the tables, so you don't feel like you're in a school canteen like in the Soho restaurant.Waiters are friendly as usual.

7Gcqn_omatkvmWkg01j0pw.text: I really, really like the food and the whole experience here. I can definitely recommend the jungle curry and brown rice  the rice even comes in a little wooden tub. The seating is set out on large tables so it's quite likely you'll be sharing with strangers. This makes it better as somewhere to go on the way to or from somewhere else rather than as an intimate meal.This branch gets very busy with queues out the door so I'd suggest you get there early.

mMbP_454vxyMrirYC-4o7g.text: Im a regular at Busaba, absolutely looove to deep fried squid and the Pad Thai.Atmosphere is chilled, you'll have to share a table but its not that bad once you sit down.Only thing I think they could improve is to have an ambience music on.apart from that its great!

9y7m2S380_Q8pE0KoKjALg.text: I wasn't planning on going to this branch, but they lucked out because East London was easier to get to in the snow than any of the Central branches. And it was the perfect choice. The food is the same as you'd expect in any of the branches (I went straight to the squid and beef with ginger - I've tried a lot of the menu but those are my absolute favourites). I also got to try the monkfish curry, which was tasty, but not my favourite (always too much sauce, but that's handy for roti dipping). The staff were friendly, and we even stuck around for an extra portion of squid at the end of our meal. Yummy yummy yummy. Well worth trekking across London in the snow for. Really. Thing I like about Busaba (aside from the squid) is that you don't feel like you're intruding in someone's space, even with the communal seating. It's busy, but you can still have your own conversation. This branch was quiet, so we didn't feel rushed at all. It's not the kind of place you want to linger in, but you'll come out full, happy, not that much poorer (dinner for two with drinks £40) and maybe even with a takeaway box for another portion of squid. Go.

OivpKQ0CJf7Dd-UZJZ4ubA.text: I was quite surprised with Busaba because I wasn't expecting a lot from a chain restaurant. Their chicken green curry is excellent. Try their Jasmine Tea smoothie too, it's delicious!

dTScksgYCZFV5QiHPd4VOA.text: LOVE. THIS. PLACE.The ambience is so lovely, perfect lighting & friendly and efficient staff.I've been quite a few times now, i find that its best to go with a few friends so that you can take up a whole table yourselves, that way you don't have to share with strangers. But to be honest, i'm not too bothered by that at all and the times i've been with just one other i've thoroughly enjoyed.The food.. my god the food..My personal favourites have to be the 'Black pepper beef' & 'Red lamb curry'. The rice is cooked perfectly and i cant forget to mention the 'Ginger & honey tea' which I ordered randomly once and now cant live without haha...& The toilets are awesome.. and clean!!!!Definitely give this place a go! it's always much quieter in the weekday daytimes so if its just a couple of you i recommend checking it out then!

uWyQ3x0zgBSKMHcH1Xp8yQ.text: My boyfriend brought me here and I really liked it up until the food. You all sit fairly close together but not to the point that I ended up going home with the wrong person or that I got to hear every intimate detail of their conversation which is fine however I was expecting more from the food. My squid starter was overcooked and slightly cold by the time it arrived. I'm a big pad thai fan so was hoping this would be an improvement only it wasn't. It lacked taste and was rather on the small side. Even though the place is massive the lighting and wooden tables give a delicate intimacy. Just the thing when you want to have a lovely dinner not ruined by light.

WXH7G2DwvbrChnMkXaJsCw.text: I judge all thai restaurants on the curry... and the curry here was GREAT.  however, the SERVICE?!  Came here for the first time and it was quite nice.. but the 2nd time (on a friday night) - NOT nice. Was with a group of 5 and the server decided upon himself to keep the change. We actually had to ask for the change?!  plus.. the red wine was sour however, in good conversation and dining, I did not notice until the glass was 1/2 empty so I didn't complain. Customer beware.

5JApz1UM7IitlZkcvxihLw.text: We had Ginger beef, Garlic pepper ostrich, Thai calamari, Chinese broccoli. It was fantastic. All of the dishes had their own distinct flavours and were cooked to perfection and also felt quite unique. They had a very interesting beer, Beerlao. The price is very reasonable and comparable to the Brick Lane curry houses but the food here is better quality and much more interesting. The atmosphere was great, being not too crowded and we didn't feel pressured to order quickly or rushed to get us out. A great find.

5UE9P3UN3w2qqb6bCkrD_w.text: From other reviews I was expecting something akin to Wagamama's (ie quick and canteenish), but instead found myself rather impressed by Busaba. Reasonably priced dishes, great presentation, nice vibe, and EVERYTHING was delish. They only lose a star because the sweet potato in my stir fry was a little undercooked (I know - I'm strict), but I love love loved my meal all the same. The table-sharing situation didn't feel intrusive, and the service was good, even when it got busy. Also really nice to see a place be generous with the cashew nuts in the cashew dishes as well. Glorious. Will definitely come back.

gZj-GRKw7jxmlbj6CKxkeQ.text: I love Busaba and was really excited to go here recently.The problem with this Old St branch is the waiters don't seem to communicate with each other and they brought us two glasses of wine instead of 1 wine, 1 lemonade and a water.. We would have gladly taken the wine for free though ;)When ordering I was told the ginger and peppercorn calamari was coming without the peppercorns. Is that not the half the essence of the dish?! Curious, I ordered it anyway as I love Busaba thai calamari. It was really bland, and I shouldn't have ordered it (my mistake).We had to ask 3 waiters to bring us the bill at the end of the meal and another couple to bring us some water throughout.I'll still eat at Busaba, it would be nice if the staff were a bit more organised though.

w82zICdW9RW8YWiHW6DAFA.text: I like it here, it's a bit like Wagamamas except better ambiance and the food is a bit 'deeper' flavour-wise.  I had coconut rice and some beef/ginger/peanut dish which was great. Be warned though- there are small hidden chillies that if you bite into you will probably die. It's a little overpriced, but the quality is high.

QBeb46IQFdI8iHAgcdSrCA.text: I was ecstatic when the latest branch of Busaba Eathai opened in Old St last month. Shoreditch usually grits its teeth at chains opening in an area which is largely populated by indies however it seems by the creative launch I attended the day before it's official opening, that this one is welcomed with opening arms. There is something quite cult like about Busaba and its clean fresh wooden interior. They did a very good job of gutting out what used to be Shish (no kebab smells apparent) and the food is fab as per usual. There are (to my knowledge) no other competitors of this standard. Yelo in the square is still a favourite for quick bites. Miso (in my opinion) is awful. Busaba is definitely one for the lunchtime treats - even casual business lunches. I have now visited every branch of Busaba - Bird St being my previous favourite. This one is 30 seconds away from where I work - happy :)

j0icv-i5xKv7vm-sj7AjVA.text: Amazing thai food!So good I went back the next day to another location to try different dish...Will definitely come back!

ht1TfojkMAM71N5Wk2oWuA.text: Probably one of the worst experiences i have had at their chain. I am a frequent visitor of the U.K. and i usually always go there because i know their food will be tasteful. I went last weekend, some folks came in after me and they were served before me. I was looked at several times and walked by, then finally someone came to me asking me if i was ready to order, my response was "Yes, i have been waiting"... the manager came over, i told him that i was sitting for a while before anyone even addressed me, and no apology followed. I think the principle is that, you acknowledge when a customer is feeling as though something was done incorrectly or if they feel overlooked, especially when done INTENTIONALLY. They should consider removing ALL their staff and getting qualified customer service oriented servers and managers, or shutting the restaurant down and doing a full week training. I will NEVER be back to this location. I had to even send my food back because the quality even looked and tasted poorly - maybe the chef was upset.... I asked for the bill and went to the other location in SoHo. I suggest that you do NOT visit this location, and go to SoHo or one of the other locations. You will be better off :).

DrUb8DegtBy5mDHq4VSR7w.text: Expect good food, but a bad dining experience.I have tried this place twice several years apart, and let me say that the food is great. I would be close to four stars for the food, but the atmosphere is horrible when the place is full. The room is nicely decorated and the fact that you sit on benches around tables with other people is not a poblem as such, but the tables are so close to each other that the waiters and other guests keep bumping into you while you are sitting in your seat. On top of that, the noice level is extremely high. If you are more than three people it will be almost impossible to have a normal conversation.

lLQJTb29FzdbdpzViVhPZQ.text: Really shouldn't have trusted Time Out London on this one!I was a little hesitant to try Thai food in London, since we have pretty great stuff here in Toronto and it seemed a little strange that Shoreditch was littered with them. We trusted some decent web reviews and peeked inside and thought that it looked like a version of Guu Izakaya in Toronto, but Thai!Unfortuately appearances can be deceiving! Busaba has literally the sweetest pad thai I've ever had. It was filling, but even with the liberal circles of sriracha I felt like I was eating a microwave dinner full of sugar and preservatives. The midpriced  sake was subpar for the price, it took us two tries to get water after our server decided to go flirt with a chef and have a smoke. As nice as the host was who sat us, it felt like they were more concerned with decor and ambiance and getting you in the door than the food. We should've gone to Brick Lane instead!

lK5locjl-o0wOZ7j6zt3bw.text: Did someone say unlimited Prosecco!? Yes please! You dont have to tell me twice so we visited Busaba Eathai for their Saturday bottemless lunch deal. We were seated on the heated outdoor terrace, decor both inside and out is well designed and carry's the thai feeling/design throughout. Beautiful exposed wood tables. Our service was quick - we had ordered both starters and mains and had out glasses filled with the good stuff within 5 minutes. My only gripe would be all our dishes arrived at the same time - with a table for 2 4 dishes made for tricky logistics! That said everything that was crammed onto our table was delicious. Highlights of Goong Tohd (crispy prawns), Thai Calamari was soft and cooked to perfection with just the right tingle of chilli. Main event of a crispy chicken roti was also pleasant (though we are on the 3rd glass of bubbles by now so my memory is a little 'fizzy!) Once we have scraped our plates cleaned we were not shooed off - infact the opposite. We were allowed to sit, chat and have out glasses topped up until the end of our 2 hour sitting. Talk about great value. I am already looking forward to going back!

photos.caption: Photo of Busaba Hoxton Square - London, United Kingdom. Unlimited prossecco lunch - yes please!

7B090SF1XC1ggjA0ONFO3Q.text: The usual yummy squid, I got the coconut curry which had quite a few things in it I couldn't/didn't want to eat, like hard bits of lemongrass (I think) and whole green chilli, but overall I enjoyed it.  I got the impression prices were higher than last time I visited but I might be mistaken. Service generally friendly and good although they do need to be attentive in the lunchtime period to people needing to pay the bill and get back to work - I delayed my friend by so long!

aMaJe6YPPnwVUgKCmCUmIg.text: Busaba Eathai at Old Street is definitely the type of place you would see next to the definition of  "Hit and Miss"... Especially when it comes down to service.Every time I have been, the food has ranged from OK to delicious, but the service has ranged from totally rude to just acceptable.For me, Thai food is all about flavour, spice and aroma - but the experience is not about a cool brand - it's about friendly service and a great atmosphere; something that Busaba Eathai lacks.It seems that this is another company guilty of being successful, making too much money and not caring about what they do any more as they will always do well. Shame. Great marketing maketh not a great company.I also find companies who do not respond to negative social media comments lack the basic foundations of what customer service is all about...! *Cough* Twitter *Cough*Don't get me wrong, I have had delicious meals here, but I have on more than one occasion left feeling underwhelmed and ripped of. As I said... Hit and miss.

sund4g34mD6Rb-rVm8EF_Q.text: Busaba Eathai at Hoxton Place came highly recommended when I was visiting the Old Street area for work recently. I ate there on a Thursday night and had no wait for a seat, which was one at a table of eight. I had the coconut water with raspberry and the pad thai, which I thought was a bit odd in comparison to the pad thai I've had in the US. There were fried shrimp in it, which was a tad like eating fish food. The seating took some getting used to, especially for someone there alone, but the food came out quickly and the service was good.

iv-pXK-EgZc4QSyh3iOttQ.text: I'm going to go ahead and just shrug at the screen right now. You can't see me doing it, but just imagine me wearing a cute outfit with my hair haphazardly thrown into a lopsided bun, yawning and shrugging. Anyways, we ended up here the other night because the queue at Pizza East was stupid and we were drunk and needed immediate foodstuffs. We sat down right away. It was described to me as a Wagamama's but with Thai food, and that's a pretty apt description. I think Wagamama's is actually more delicious, and I'm not even a huge fan. The food was instantly forgettable and I wish I had spent my £15 somewhere else. It wasn't BAD, so if you need something to eat, by all means. One person in our party had good food - it was the pumpkin and sweet potato (I think?) curry, and it was really good. I was jealous. Oh, also, the waitress tried to warn me off the jungle chicken, saying it was very spicy. If you like spicy food, you will be totally fine. It was not that hot.

UXGYRV_W2pwtwDzZ6tplug.text: Very chilled place, cool, relaxed vibe as soon as you enter the restaurant due to the incense burning. Currently celebrating 15 years so there's a special menu out featuring dishes from different regions of Thailand. I always love the fried rice there - go for the crab or the prawn chilli options. Nice place for a cheap eat. Choose the communal tables too - more atmosphere!

mV35p_otQ6gId5MInYvr5Q.text: I've only had takeaway from here so cannot comment on the atmosphere etc. As for the food, it's fine but I don't think it's Thai. My favorite Thai dish, tom kha gai, was warm and coconutty but not spicy at all and overly greasy. One of my favorite things about Thai food is all of the flavor without the feeling of being weighed down, and this was the opposite of that. I also had a green papaya salad, another one of my favorites, but again this lacked flavor. If you are looking for kind of watered down Thai adjusted for a western palate, I'd go here, but not for anything close to authentic. (I'm not Thai but lived in Southeast Asia for a couple of years and have been to Thailand a few times, so not an expert by any means but have had some Thai meals that were stupid delicious.)

FRMbgzRg3vMjuZGTNoQasw.text: Great atmosphere and delicious food. The chinese broccoli, fish curry, pepper chicken, and fried calamari were full of flavors and notably fresh. This would be a good spot for celebrating a minor accomplishment, say, wrapping up a project, welcoming a coworker, having a birthday with a couple of friends.Missing a star for value. I thought the prices were a bit high for the portion sizes. Don't arrive starving unless you're there to celebrate a raise.

trGMuSNsdRMXyUod1LjQ1g.text: Let me start by saying I loved the food I had... my fiance and I both did. The three star rating is due to the poor service.... but let's start with the food! We eat thai all over the world, so I feel like we have a pretty good understanding of good/not good :]We split the following: Tom Kha soup, chinese broccoli, vegetable spring rolls, sticky rice and red lamb curry. I have to say - all were outstanding. I can't speak to the noodle dishes, but these were great. They really lost us on the service though. We asked for water & the bill many times and didn't get either until 20 minutes had passed and my fiance finally stood up with the credit card in his hand (side note - we are very patient patrons as we were both servers, so we do anything to keep from being rude to the wait staff).   The food I would give 5 stars; the service 2... so we meet in the middle(ish). Maybe you'll have more luck!

Q27Alk13jHuZ7KEgD4SXuA.text: Upon first visit to any Thai place, I go with the Pad Thai - if you impress with that dish, it's mostly a good sign that everything else will be great.  Needless to say, the Sen Chan Pad Thai impressed me - shrimp ("prawn" for you English folks) and crab meat (didn't seem like imitation crab) were cooked nicely and blended well with everything else in the dish.  Service was OK, nothing impressive.  Will go back soon to try something different.

nFCRxPzy6whewx2JNigeEw.text: A rather pleasant place around this area [Old Street] but i can't say I was impressed with their food. The place looks nice, I find the big windows slightly too intrusive as all the pass-byers are too much of a distraction,. It doesn't feel like a quality dining place, it's more of a canteen feel in my opinion. The staff didn't seem to be very willing to help in terms of the menu and options. It's was more of a 'eat and leave' feel. I wasn't impressed. I would definitely not say that the food is that great, though i must also mention that it may be a matter of taste. Also half way through the meal i was having, my stomach had a rather weird reaction to what I was eating, it was bad. Stomach ache and all that... I am very unimpressed with this place. I do hope others will have better experiences there than mine. ps: the restroom is lush. i must give credit to that. the sign on the door for men and women's toilet is great! hehe

photos.caption: Photo of Busaba Hoxton Square - London, United Kingdom

6jqOXsmOvRuAllam6iwYNQ.text: A lovely place to eat but overpriced. It's something different and the atmosphere is great but it could be greatly improved by being a little less pretentious. There are no desserts on the menu. Meh. Sometimes the portions are ungenerous. The chicken wings gets smaller every time I go.

iUbG_KHQ_23PNWl-iU5GNQ.text: I do worry that it's getting a little too thin on the ground. A new Busaba seems to open every other month. Soon enough, the above average prices for, what will inevitably be but isn't yet, identikit food, might just tip the balance.But in the meantime, whilst they tiptoe the fine line between successful restaurant venture and all-out chain blandness, they're just about getting it right.With more chains come less interested staff. Just there to make their dollar and get out of there. Felt some of that attitude when visiting here, but with waitstaff it's often pot luck.But the thai calimari is still one of my favourite dishes in London, doesn't matter which Busaba I have it at. So damn good.

RH_hcB0iP5A-8lZ6RDhmkg.text: I had the absolute nicest time here on sunday with a very dear friend of mine. We shared a bunch of starters which were all equally mouth wateringly ABSOLUTELY GORGEOUS. Realy lovely setting, lighting and loation too!

Jc0rFgI6TiBom0YuQaKcrA.text: Well that was terrible. Thai food for people who don't like Thai food. The duck curry was cloyingly sweet - I had the taste of sugar coating my mouth an hour later. Terribly overpriced for the quality and portion sizes. And the service was inattentive - they asked us what we wanted to order as soon as we sat down and later we had to ask a second server for water because the first wandered off to chat with friends. Don't make the same mistake. Avoid.

rCNce2wkG8SWmgmm-aDTNg.text: Solid choice but would prefer it if the price/portion ratio was slightly closer. Always leaves me feeling a little less than totally full.

M3oNYjKH5Cj4PlqhR9ZOvw.text: Amazing food and amazing staff!! After being turned away by the Shoreditch location (who conveniently decided to close 30 mins early), this particular location happily welcomed us and you can tell that they pride themselves on their service as everyone worked as a team and consistently checked on us, making sure that we were ok. Highly recommend the Hoxton location. Don't go to Shoreditch. The shrimp here was amazing!

8MXDLfUFhEOTamKGARyavA.text: Not too shabby for Thai cuisine in the middle of Shoreditch. It was a cute place and the only thing that reminded me it was Thai was the burning incense and small buddha in the front. The disappointing part was that they didn't have a lot of things on their menu which was a bit odd since it was just the beginning of the day. Aside from that, their basil beef rice plate was good and their veggie spring rolls were edible. Their "hot" wings weren't that spicy. My friend liked their soup and my other friend finished her pad thai. The fish sauce and sriracha they had on the table was clutch too when we needed some extra spice or salt to our dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Busaba Hoxton Square - London, United Kingdom. Specials
Photo of Busaba Hoxton Square - London, United Kingdom. Current menu

GNRdRnaVIHg_xfPfwK4irg.text: Not too bad but servings aren't very substantial and prices are fairly stiff. Better options in Shoreditch.If you are a single diner, they'll face you to a window so it's a rather solitary experience.

ICUQfQ0CgVaNJRbQL-BI6g.text: This Thai restaurant is located very close to Holiday Inn Express. I came here for lunch. I thought the place is big. I sat by the window facing the street. Each table offers a set of spice and sauce in case customers want extra hot and spicy. Yes! Never forget to throw that in so your tongue is burning! I thought my waiter Robert was polite and smiley. Good gesture. They're just so polite there. Even the runner would make sure I sit well to make sure I know he's ready to place the food whenever I'm ready. I ordered prawn chili with rice and water. The portion size was small to medium, enough to keep me energized for the afternoon. The prawn chili was delicious. I recommend this dish if you like seafood. The lunch bill was reasonable. Unlike in NY, most Thai restaurants offer lunch specials so the dish comes with either spring roll or soup or salad. I don't remember seeing lunch menu. I think they have the same menu for dinner too. Funny story... While eating I kept hearing 2 women talking in the background. They spoke Thai. I thought there were 2 employees behind me not doing their job but doing the talking instead. After paying the bill I got up and turned and saw the 2 women sitting at the table enjoying their meals and talking. Language! Why can't I master them all so I know not to assume? Hey! I'm in Thai restaurant. I thought that's funny. Btw I didn't see any Thai employees here. Maybe they work night shift? Whatever the case is I just want to say I had a very good lunch at this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Busaba Hoxton Square - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Busaba Hoxton Square - London, United Kingdom. Rice!
Photo of Busaba Hoxton Square - London, United Kingdom. Chili prawn

7A8cA9Fi8BK5hlEo-SaGeQ.text: Nope. Appetizers were good. Tasty and fresh and came out quickly. Got the sweet and sour chicken with jasmine rice. Took a while to get out on a Thursday night. Underwhelming presentation and the taste was meh. The dish had four (4) pieces of chicken, around 10 pineapple chunks and a boatload of onions. The taste was boring and the meal was lukewarm. If it weren't for the hot rice I dropped on top, I think the plate would have been much colder. With a whopping four pieces of chicken, I left after eating and had to pick up dinner #2 as I was still hungry. On a side note, it was loud as f_ck in the restaurant as well. Won't be going back.

1_uhXWb25s1s-Ur9TYLwzg.text: We came here mainly because we couldn't find another restaurant in Shoreditch that can seat 7 people right away. The restaurant was fairly empty as it was early in the night and we made it in time for the dinner special (2 course meal for 11 quid). I had the beef stir fry and it is probably one of the blandest things I've ever eaten. I asked for extra spicy but the dish was not spicy at all. I guess not much should be expected from a chain restaurant but I was disappointed nonetheless.

photos.caption: Photo of Busaba Hoxton Square - London, United Kingdom

mzYbZOibj3NDgZ-yTfUK7w.text: We ordered take away from Busaba and were very disappointed. We will not be returning. We opted for the classic pad Thai and the Mussaman duck. The pad Thai was described to have "King prawns" which actually equated to only 4 very small shrimp and overall a very small serving in general. The duck curry was much better, however I found the duck to be very dry.

2iOUNPLYlRfjjGDtLMw3JA.text: I've been here twice while visiting London on business. The last time I was there, I was seated at a table with 9 of my favorite strangers. Talk about awkward. My starter never came out and and when my main dish came out and I asked about my starter, the waiter gave me some lame excuse suggesting that he was not going to follow up with it. I could barely hear him over the noise level. The acoustics in the room just don't seem ideal for a restaurant. When I asked for the check, I was charged for 4 of the strangers on the table. My starter never showed up. After adjusting the bill 4 times, I left there in a huff swearing to never return. I'll be going to the one in Shoreditch going forward. Oh, the food was delicious as usual though. But the awkwardness and poor service did not make up for it.

uy8yw6VR-3-1o5O4LMSxmg.text: I came to the Busaba Hoxton location today for their 50% off food throughout the whole of January promotion.  I'm usually not the one to complain when getting a discount, however, the customer experience was not pleasent and thought I'd let our fellow Yelpers know - especially when taking advantage of the half off offer.Firstly the offer - I found out through Yelp, the Busaba website and on Timeout here: now-here-this.timeout.co….  The Busaba website specifically states "Pay with the Busaba app in January 2015 when dining in to receive 50% off your food bill." and Timeout specifically states "All you need to do is download the Busaba Eathai app and present the discount code when ordering."I was going to dinner with two others and thought cool, let's go to Busaba and take advantage of the half off deal.  We got there early to beat the queue and ate.  When we sat down I told the waiter we're here for the 50% deal and he said no problem, jut download the app.  Cool...  Service was slow but not terrible.  Food was OK.  I got the pad thai and it was greasy.I then downloaded the Busaba app to get ready to pay the bill.  I downloaded the app just fine but when I launched it, the app wanted all this personal details including Name, email and most importantly credit card or paypal details.  Really annoying as I don't like giving this info unnecessarily but for the 50% discount, I guess I'll give it.When we got the bill it was full priced so I flagged down our waiter and he asked to see the app.  I showed him the app but he wanted a code from it.  I then showed him the code. He then said I needed to pay via the app - I thought fine, this is part of the 50% deal.  On the app itself, you can split the bill - so we did - I paid my third via paypal.  My two other friends were ready to pay with their physical credit cards however they were not allowed to pay via credit cards - we had to pay via the app!  I guess that's what the deal said up front @Pay with the Busaba app" but it did not say "All parties needs to have the Busaba app downloaded and linked to a credit card/paypal account".  Anyway, it was too much of a faff for my friends to download the app and go through the registration process so I just ended up paying their share of the bill.What if my friends didn't want to share their personal info with Busaba but I did already?  What if they didn't have a smart phone to download the app?  The offer is not specific enough to state that ALL parties need to pay via the Busaba app. It wasn't even that much money to save - we could have lived without the faff.  Or next time, just not gone to Busaba as it was just too much overhead to get the discount.  Really left a bad taste in my mouth leaving the restaurant!

photos.caption: Photo of Busaba Hoxton Square - London, United Kingdom. Pad Thai
Photo of Busaba Hoxton Square - London, United Kingdom. Chicken Satay

zbuI8sS7eVxO2RKNsAw0BQ.text: Average chain restaurant. Service was friendly but very slow. Food was very plain and overpriced for what it was. Can get much more for much less elsewhere. Won't be back.

UdUknJtQ1OHXTD3eJBJE4w.text: I love this Busaba in old st. they are very efficient there and well the food is always good, I just think some plates are a little bit price for what they offer but the calamari is amazing! I always go of some chicken satay and coconut rice if you want you can fill up with some Chinese broccoli and voilá!

photos.caption: Photo of Busaba Hoxton Square - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Busaba Hoxton Square - London, United Kingdom. Pad Thai
Photo of Busaba Hoxton Square - London, United Kingdom. Chiken breast

JrDunCoSH6uI0USGvxU-4w.text: Aw c'mon! What's with all the 3 stars!!!Busaba is great with delicious fusion-ish Thai food! Loving the canteen style dining tables and the cool relaxing chill out atmosphere! MM! Yummy drinks yum yum! Lemongrass and ginger pressé and their coconut water mixes are goooood!Green papaya salad, calamari, morning glory and pad thai jay are on my to-go list! Everything else is also good with alright prices. Portions aren't huge, considering the pricing isn't super expensive anyway.Does get crowded on weekends and even weekday nights.

V7i_BedO53mdOwZwJi6T_w.text: This Busaba has well trained staff which pay attention to their customer and offer genuine Thai food.They serve quite fast and always keep me informed which I called good services. The food are also tasty and pimping hot. Will definitely come again.

photos.caption: Photo of Busaba Hoxton Square - London, United Kingdom. Grill chicken with rice
Photo of Busaba Hoxton Square - London, United Kingdom. Spring roll
Photo of Busaba Hoxton Square - London, United Kingdom. Thai pad

iCjbhxZFE0Nsh0UmQdux9w.text: Well, the service is ok but the food it's not good at all. This is not even close to thai food. We ordered the pad Thai chicken, the duck curry and the calamari... the best thing about it was the Diet Coke. Very disappointed about  the food quality and taste.

sNUXUUVEkZHwOCM3JxOXXg.text: It's fine, but there's better.  We've gotten takeaway from this Busaba a couple times, and it's varied a little.  The service has been very efficient, even in the face of an online ordering snafu from DineIn, so that's a plus.  But the food is just not amazing.Admittedly, we've only had pad thai, pad seiuw, panang curry, and tom yum from these guys, but none of those dishes would score above a 6 out of 10 on my scale.  The last time, our pad thais were very bland and the chicken was chewy - probably closer to a 4 than a 6.  I'll be sticking to Thai Thai up the street despite their weird and erratic discounts and occasional breakdowns in service, because their curries and soups are just much better.  Still looking for a good Thai noodle place.

ovg5q54A6Vr7BsxylhO6Aw.text: So let us suppose that you work around Liverpool Street. On a sunny Friday, you decide to explore the area around Shoreditch with your mates to find a place to have lunch. You start at 11:45 and get in a quiet restaurant, so calm and peaceful that you thought you were at a Buddhist temple. But then, by 13:00, the temple turned into a party zone. The place got so full that we had to wait 20 minutes to get our bill. We even cancelled our second order of lemonade as we were tired of waiting. I must say they are probably understaffed at busy times. Apart from that, the food was decent. I will definitely give them a better rating once they decide to hire enough waiters to serve the number of people that come in at lunch time.

D5T7nNira9PVKAQxFdCiBA.text: Came here for my bday lunch. Nice place with nice food and friendly staff... Little pricey but will probably come again.

Wq4jqJ1XEbnxC3_4_HF6MQ.text: Delicious menu, bottomless prosecco (2 hour max sitting) and great (ish) service. The food was fresh and extremely tasty, try the calamari for a starter and the massaman curry roti with sweet potato fries for a main. Our server was lovely and catered to our needs. However her manager took over our table as she has to go on a break and she was less accommodating. Felt like we were being naughty school kids and were told off for being given an extra glass of prosecco! Aside from her unnecessarily authoritative demeanour overall experience was great!

photos.caption: Photo of Busaba Hoxton Square - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Busaba Hoxton Square - London, United Kingdom. long liquid lunch !!!!

iAGNV_0BredlTAHPf75g0w.text: Went here for a friend's birthday. Great choice of food on the menu. I must say, it is rather daunting to go there by yourself if you've never been before as the menu doesn't give much off by way of help.I had the Tom kha chicken as my main dish. But their side dishes are perfect. They offer a great variety of dishes, which all have their very own distinct flavour. I cannot get enough of the Thai Calamari and the Chicken Satay. Those dishes are a must have when you go.The only bad thing about this place is the fact that they don't take reservations. It is very annoying having to line up outside waiting for a table, especially during the dinner service. But it is definitely worth the wait. Enjoy.N.B.: As they do not take reservations, you might want to get there earlier and be prepared to wait until a table is ready for you. This is especially important when you're with a large group.

R91AeTGaXFvRppEP0Vw-kA.text: I ordered here through Deliveroo. They didn't bring the drink I ordered. I also got food poisoning from the food here. I was up all night with a high fever, chills,    diarrhea and felt like I was going to throw up all night. The food tasted off and I shouldn't have kept eating. I've never had food poisoning in my life. Please beware of this place!
